summary: Head and neck cancer is a term for cancers that develop in the mouth, nose and sinuses, salivary glands, and throat and voice box (larynx). Most head and neck cancers are squamous cell cancers, beginning in the moist tissues lining the head and neck. The cancer cells can spread into deeper tissue as the cancer grows.
risk_factors: History of head or neck cancer
Exposure to certain toxic substances at work
Radiation exposure to the head and neck
symptoms: Sore in the mouth or throat that does not heal
Painful sore in the mouth or throat
Sore throat that does not go away
Change or hoarseness in the voice
